edu.mills.cs180a.classfeedback

Class CommentsDataSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.mills.cs180a.classfeedback.CommentsDataSource

  • public class CommentsDataSource
extends Object
    Persistent data storage for Comment using a database defined in MySQLiteOpenHelper. This reuses code from Android SQLite database and content provider - Tutorial by Lars Vogella.
    Author:
    ellen.spertus@gmail.com (Ellen Spertus)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CommentsDataSource(Context context)
      Constructs a CommentsDataSource.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommentsDataSource

        public CommentsDataSource(Context context)
        Constructs a CommentsDataSource. The open() method must be called before retrieving data from this.
        Parameters:
        context - required context for the associated SQLiteDatabase

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public void open()
          throws SQLException
        Opens a connection to the database, creating it if necessary. This should be called before any of the other methods. When the connection is no longer needed, close() should be called.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if the database could not be opened

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the connection to the database, opened with open().

      • createComment

        Comment createComment(String recipient,
                    String content)
        Creates a comment with the specified content for the specified recipient. If the recipient has no associated comment, this adds the comment to the database. If the recipient already has an associated comment, this replaces the comment in the database for that recipient. This method also then constructs a new Comment instance with the given information.
        Parameters:
        recipient - the email address of the recipient
        content - the content of the comment
        Returns:
        a new Comment instance for the given recipient with the given content

      • getCursorForCommentForRecipient

        Cursor getCursorForCommentForRecipient(String recipient,
                                     String[] projection)
        Queries the database for the comment associated with the specified recipient.
        Parameters:
        recipient - the email address of the target of the comment
        projection - the names of the columns to retrieve
        Returns:
        a Cursor pointing to the comment for the recipient (if any)

      • getCursorForAllComments

        Cursor getCursorForAllComments(String[] projection)
        Queries database for all comments.
        Parameters:
        projection - the names of the columns to retrieve
        Returns:
        a Cursor referencing all comments in the database

      • getAllComments

        List<Comment> getAllComments(String[] projection)
        Retrieve all comments from the database.
        Returns:
        all comments in the database

      • getCommentForRecipient

        Comment getCommentForRecipient(String recipient,
                             String[] projection)
        Retrieves the comment associated with the given recipient in the database.
        Parameters:
        recipient - the email address of the target of the comment
        projection - the names of the columns to retrieve
        Returns:
        the comment associated with the given recipient in the database

      • deleteCommentForRecipient

        boolean deleteCommentForRecipient(String recipient)
        Deletes the comment associated with the given recipient in the database.
        Parameters:
        recipient - the email address of the target of the comment to delete
        Returns:
        true if the comment was successfully deleted from the database; otherwise false
